content.question:
The function f is differentiable for all real numbers. The point <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AF0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is on the graph of y = f(x), and the slope at each point (x, y) on the graph is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4253@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(a) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C49@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and evaluate it at the point <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AF0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

frqParts.text:
The function f is differentiable for all real numbers. The point <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AF0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is on the graph of y = f(x), and the slope at each point (x, y) on the graph is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4253@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(a) Find <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C49@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and evaluate it at the point <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>,</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AF0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

(b) Find y = f(x) by solving the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>6</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4253@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with the initial condition f(3) = 1/4.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
